intro: Valeriana officinalis subsp. tenuifolia, commonly known as slender valerian, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clustered inflorescences, which bloom from June to August. Its rhizomatous root system is the primary source of its medicinal compounds, including valerenic acid and essential oils. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
